intro: Melandrium capitatum, commonly known as the clustered catchfly, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other flowering plants such as carnations and moss campion. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and woodland edges. It produces clusters of small, pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The leaves are oval-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
